snippet: For Spain, Portugal, Italy and Greece, economists are hoping that this year’s record influx of sun-seeking tourists and their money will continue past summer’s end.
abstract: Spain, Portugal, Italy and Greece are hoping that 2013’s record influx of sun-seeking tourists and their money will continue past summer’s end; southern European countries hit hardest by euro debt crisis are reaping benefits of increased tourism.

byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: For Spain, Portugal, Italy and Greece, economists are hoping that this year’s record influx of sun-seeking tourists and their money will continue past summer’s end.

headline.main: Tourists Wary of Turmoil in the Middle East Are a Boon to Southern Europe
headline.print_headline: Tourists Wary of Turmoil in the Middle East Are a Boon to Southern Europe
